author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Honor Flight Chicago Hosts 87 WWII Veterans For Last Flight Of 2015 SeasonTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Honor Flight Chicago Hosts 87 WWII Veterans For Last Flight Of 2015 Season Published on : Thursday, October 1, 2015
This morning, 87 World War II veterans from the Midwest were treated to a special morning send-off celebration at Midway International Airport prior to their departure to Washington D.C. for a day trip to visit the WWII Memorial.
Today marked the last of six flights for the 2015 season. Since April, nearly 600 World War II heroes have visited Washington, D.C.
Honor Flight Chicago founders (L-r) Mary Pettinato, Suzanne Stanits, Nance Kapp and Jeanmarie Kapp Joining the veterans and their guardians were the four founders of Honor Flight Chicago.
While in the nation’s capital today, the veterans will experience a day of remembrance and reminiscing for some who have waited more than 60 years to see the WWII Memorial. The veterans will also visit the Iwo Jima, Lincoln, Korean and Vietnam memorials.
Honor Flight Chicago and Southwest Airlines facilitate the trips.
The morning’s departure celebration included performances by the vocal trio, Legacy Girls, who pay tribute to the famous Andrew Sisters.
Midway Airport Concessions (MAC One) provided breakfast for the veterans before boarding their plane.
Hundreds of family, friends and supporters are expected to welcome the veterans when they return to Midway this evening. In addition, dozens of active duty military personnel and Chicago Police Department Pipes and Drums Corps will participate in the arrival festivities.
Spurce:- Chicago Department of Aviation
